ARABIC: أَرَءَيْتَ مَنِ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَٰهَهُۥ هَوَىٰهُ أَفَأَنتَ تَكُونُ عَلَيْهِ وَكِيلًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Have you seen him who has taken his whims and desires to be his god? Will you then be his guardian?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Have you considered him who takes his own lust for his god? Can you stand a surety for him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Have you ever considered the case of the person who has made his lust his god? Can you take the responsibility of guiding such a one aright?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: How can you be the guardian of those who have chosen their own desires as their Lord?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Did you see the one who chose his own desires as his God? So will you accept the responsibility of guarding him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Have you seen him who has taken as his god his own vain desire Would you then be a guardian over him
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Have you seen him who takes his low desires for his god? Will you then be a protector over him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Hast thou seen him who has taken his caprice to be his god? Wilt thou be a guardian over them?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Hast thou seen him who chooseth for his god his own lust? Wouldst thou then be guardian over him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Have you seen him who has taken his own desire to be his god? Can you be a guardian over him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Hast thou observed him who hath taken as his god his own desire! wilt thou be over him a trustee?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Have you seen him who has taken his desire to be his god? Is it your duty to watch over him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Seest thou such a one as taketh for his god his own passion (or impulse)? Couldst thou be a disposer of affairs for him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Have you (O Muhammad SAW) seen him who has taken as his ilah (god) his own desire? Would you then be a Wakil (a disposer of his affairs or a watcher) over him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Have you seen him who has made gods of his own desires? Would you be a guardian over him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Have you seen him who chose his desire as his god? Would you be an agent for him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Have you seen the one who takes as his god his own desire? Then would you be responsible for him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [25:43] Have you seen — inform Me [about] — him who has taken as his god his own desire?, that is, as something that will be bring about his ruin (the indirect object [ilāhahu, ‘as his god’] precedes the direct object because it is more important; the clause [beginning] man ittakhadha, ‘him who has taken’, constitutes the first direct object of a-ra’ayta, ‘have you seen’, the second being [the following, a-fa-anta …]) Will you be a guardian over him?, a protector to preserve him from following his desires? No.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Hast thou) Muhammad (seen him who chooseth for his god his own lust) who worshipped his god, i.e. al- Nadr and his host, out of the whim of his ego? (Wouldst thou) Muhammad (then be guardian over him) a protector against going out for such corruption? But this was abrogated by the verse of jihad; it is also said that this means: would you be their protector from chastisement?
